info.author: Michael Christoph Nowotny
info.description:
# pyjags_arviz Makes MCMC samples from PyJAGS usable in ArviZ ## Table of Contents 1. [Installation](#installation) 2. [Getting Started](#getting-started) ## Installation 1. Install via PIP: 
    pip install pyjags_arviz
or 
    pip3 install pyjags_arviz
if not using Anaconda. To get the latest version, clone the repository from github, open a terminal/command prompt, navigate to the root folder and install via 
    pip install .
or 
    pip3 install .
if not using Anaconda. ## Usage Import the function convert_pyjags_samples_dict_to_arviz_inference_data via 
from pyjags_arviz import convert_pyjags_samples_dict_to_arviz_inference_data
Having sampled the from the posterior distribution using PyJAGS via 
samples \
    = jags_model.sample(...)
one can write 
idata = convert_pyjags_samples_dict_to_arviz_inference_data(samples)
to convert the dictionary returned from PyJAGS to an ArviZ InferenceData object. This object can be used in ArviZ to generate trace plots and compute diagnostics. Trace plot: 
az.plot_trace(idata)
Effective sample size: 
az.ess(idata)
Gelman and Rubin statistic: 
az.rhat(idata)
info.name: pyjags-arviz
info.summary: Makes MCMC samples from PyJAGS usable in ArviZ
info.html_description:
pyjags_arviz

Makes MCMC samples from PyJAGS usable in ArviZ

Table of Contents

  1. Installation
  2. Getting Started

Installation

  1. Install via PIP:

    pip install pyjags_arviz

    or

    pip3 install pyjags_arviz

    if not using Anaconda.

    To get the latest version, clone the repository from github, open a terminal/command prompt, navigate to the root folder and install via

    pip install .

    or

    pip3 install .

    if not using Anaconda.

Usage

Import the function convert_pyjags_samples_dict_to_arviz_inference_data via

from pyjags_arviz import convert_pyjags_samples_dict_to_arviz_inference_data

Having sampled the from the posterior distribution using PyJAGS via

samples \
    = jags_model.sample(...)

one can write

idata = convert_pyjags_samples_dict_to_arviz_inference_data(samples)

to convert the dictionary returned from PyJAGS to an ArviZ InferenceData object.

This object can be used in ArviZ to generate trace plots and compute diagnostics.
Trace plot:

az.plot_trace(idata)

Effective sample size:

az.ess(idata)

Gelman and Rubin statistic:

az.rhat(idata)
